title: Machine Learning Fundamentals
description: Test your ML knowledge: algorithms, evaluation, and concepts

questions.question: What is the purpose of cross-validation?
options: To evaluate model performance on unseen data
questions.explanation: Cross-validation helps evaluate performance and reduce overfitting by testing on different data splits.

questions.question: Which algorithm is best suited for non-linear classification?
questions.explanation: Decision trees can handle non-linear relationships through hierarchical decision boundaries.

questions.question: Overfitting occurs when a model performs well on training data but poorly on test data.
questions.explanation: Yes, overfitting means the model memorized training data but doesn't generalize well.

questions.question: What does 'bias-variance tradeoff' refer to?
questions.explanation: The tradeoff between underfitting (high bias) and overfitting (high variance) by adjusting model complexity.

questions.question: Which metric is best for imbalanced classification problems?
questions.explanation: Accuracy can be misleading with imbalanced data. Precision and F1-Score provide better insights.
